instruction: Produce a plan for teaching basic philosophy.
output:
1. Introduction to the philosophical method and basic concepts (Metaphysics, Epistomology, Ethics, Aesthetics, etc.).
2. History of Philosophy - Ancient to Contemporary 
3. Eastern and non-Western Philosophies 
4. Philosophical Ethics 
5. Analytic Philosophy 
6. Continental Philosophy
7. Logic and Critical Thinking
8. Modern Ethical Theory 
9. Contemporary Debates in Society 
10. Application of Philosophy to the Arts and Humanities 
11. Applications of Philosophy to Human Condition 
12. Debate and Argumentation
13. Religion and God 
14. Free Will and Determinism 
15. Death and Meaning of Life 
16. Gender and Race 
17. Economics and Politics 
18. Technology and Social Change 
19. Synthesis - Evaluation of Themes
